lines.text: Anything's legal until you get caught!
For ten cents I'd go down to the bank and close out my account.
Why? You still wouldn't have enough to pay for a shave!
[when the deputy sheriff rides up, Pinky quickly mounts his horse]
My conscience is clear, but my horse's isn't.
I'd give a month's salary for a look at that map.
That ain't much money, but I'll give it a shot.
How did you get so many people to attend our dance?
They all owe me money or hope to.
[Whopper is startled by a black cat]
Ain't nothin' but a black cat!
[Outlaws threaten to kill Pinky if he doesn't leave camp]
I've got to leave camp. It's a matter of life and death!
[reading a sign announcing the creation of a new dam building corporation]
Looks like we'll have to change our town's name from Dry Camp to Watertown.
